content: single_crochet you will be moving the stitch marker which is why your stitch count is more in this round connecting the lens work 4 sl stitches across the middle of the lenses to connect them together sweet oddity art 9 goggles continued 1 work 27 single_crochet around the edge of the lens slip_stitch in the divot on the bottom of the lenses work 27 single_crochet more around the right lens work 3 double_crochet in the divot on top change to color d 2 blo half_double_crochet around 3 half_double_crochet in each st around f/o and weave in your tail ends google strap attach color d yarn to the side of the goggles with a slip_stitch chain approximately 61 you may need to adjust this number try to see if the chain wraps around the yeti s head when you put the goggles on his face attach to the opposite side of the goggles with a slip_stitch turn and single_crochet across the chain f/o and weave in the ends sweet oddity art 10 snowboard make one in color c and one in color d starting with color c chain 36 1 single_crochet in the 2nd chain from hook 33 single_crochet inc3 in the last chain working on the opposite side of the chain 33 single_crochet increase in the last chain= 72 2 increase 33 single_crochet increase x 3 33 single_crochet increase x 2= 78 3 single_crochet increase 33 single_crochet single_crochet increase x 3 33 single_crochet single_crochet increase x 2= 84 4 2 single_crochet increase 33 single_crochet 2 single_crochet increase x 3 33 single_crochet 2 single_crochet increase x 2= 90 5 3 single_crochet increase 33 single_crochet 3 single_crochet increase x 3 33 single_crochet 3 single_crochet increase x 2= 96 do not f/o the color d board place the back sides of both boards together and single_crochet around the edges to connect them together f/o and weave in the ends bindings scarf with color d with color f chain 12 chain 110 1 single_crochet in the 2nd chain from hook and across= 11 1 half_double_crochet in 2nd chain from hook f/o and leave a long tail for sewing and across f/o and leave a medium tail for sewing you have your finished shaun the yeti thank you for your purchase if you have any questions or concerns please email me at sweetoddityart@gmail com or etsy convo me i will get back to you asap please share your finished yeti with me as often as you want i love seeing them sweet oddity art 11 assembly head and body 1 thread your needle with a long strand of black yarn insert the needle into the bottom of the head and bring the needle to a hole approximately between rounds 20 and 21 embroider a smile 2 cut a long strand of white thread and insert the needle into the bottom of the head bring the needle up to the smile embroider a triangle for a tooth on each side of the smile weave in the
